Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: We are however shifting to focus more on creating a better developer community program, along with renewed focus on how we educate, train, and attract more developers to Komodo.

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: We've been positioning Komodo as having "a hybrid approach to privacy" - Optional zk-snarks/priv tx (jumblr) along with permission-less and permissioned blockchains

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: We're emphasizing choice

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: I'm working with CA on an updated roadmap, and an update around the rebranding and marketing plans with Ideas By Nature

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: We're currently in the discovery phase, but once we set a master charter in place we can do regular updates to the community to track progress and get valuable input

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: That prism model is becoming quite popular it seems, I'm pretty sure that's how Abra works too, which is why many coins on abra you cannot withdraw from the wallet.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: It's really a derivative I'd say, you're trading on the coin and portfolio valuation and not necessarily trading the coins themselves. so the volume there does nothing for the volume anywhere else, but it's good to get Komodo logo and idea in front of people.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I also don't think I'd want to be Prism in this case, this whole model exposes them to some insane potential losses. If they hold ETH in contract and allow you to trade against it, any of the gains must be made up from losses elsewhere (either individual portfolios) or their own. Think if you put in ETH, "buy" bitcoin and bitcoin goes back to 20k and you cash out, you have just about tripled your ETH holdings (assuming ETH didn't grow proportionally)...now imagine thousands of people did that. All that extra ETH has to come from somewhere

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: I've responded in a comment appropriately.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
waiting for approval by blokt
```

Cool article - great to see higher throughput from EOS.

TPS record was set by Komodo in May 2018 at 20k tps, data here https://komodostats.com/sca...

And description here: https://i.mylomylo.com/komo...

KMD news article about the method https://komodoplatform.com/...

And a more recent load test: https://en.insider.pro/info... with infographic https://insdrcdn.com/media/...

Komodo will post all details for download and verifiability throughout further testing.

Any details please ask Mylo in the KMD discord (#scaling-test) for further details. We will continue to optimise KMD scaling solutions to 1 million tps.

Cheers
```

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
i don't mind starting a website that rebutts all these things to highlight KMDs advantages - if the community finds sites claiming things that are not and i can republish things from komodo's perspective that are justified and true - then let's do it.

As part of the Komodo Pioneers notary election, we encourage ppl to start meetups.  Because I'm least likely to participate in meetup activities, I threw the idea of a komodo ecosystem website https://imgur.com/a/n7qG2 (this is the mockup).

If the community wants some way to republish information, i can work towards iKomodo being a community site.  I've got the ways of getting accurate information required through dev/marketing/community here - just need to work on the publishing model.  And once someone works out how (and shares how) to IPFS host  (decentralized web) something like this, then ikomodo doesn't have to be the centralized point of accuracy.

There's reddit.com/r/ikomodo we can use, it's private at the moment but if this is a direction the community marketing wants to go - let's do it.

Need 10 KMD emojis and we start.
